title: Player dodged with 8 seconds but game started anyway

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
Our **jungler** didn't get the role they wanted, so they picked and **decided to dodge** with **eight seconds left** in the final countdown.  This prompted a message in the lobby that the player had left, but **the countdown continued**.

The **game loaded 4v5** and naturally we couldn't pull together and win the game, and even though we were only down seven kills we decided to surrender.  

I e-mailed support, but they just sent me a canned response about how they can't change match history.  That's not even what I want.  

I want Riot to _**investigate why the game didn't drop us back into the queue after the player dodged**_.

Unranked draft on the Rift

replies.body: This is a serious problem, and I definitely want it looked into. When I dodge, I do it to AVOID losing a bunch of LP (I realize this isn't ranked, but the bug may exist there, too). That needs to work.

^ then he obviously dc'ed O.o whether accidentally or intentionally....either stayed out because net was terrible OR decided NOT to go back in....whatever the case. My friend sometimes gets dc'ed at the champ select...and I had it too before. If the dc happens not too far from when the game is going to start...the game thinks of reconnecting the person and starts the game anyways. I have also had this happen to where I see "[Player 2] has joined the room." after like 10seconds. Meaning the person had some sort of connection problem BUT was still connecting to the room and just happened to get in late. Both come from connection problems...
...that doesn't change what I said.

If his client was delayed due to packet loss/lag, then he wouldn't have received the packets that said his teammate had left the room until after the game had started. Since he received them, that means his connection with the server was at least capable of sending him that message, and should have also updated the time correctly.
Getting packet loss doesn't mean you lose all information. If you're not getting any data, you're disconnected. Packet loss is intermittent, typically.
